sentences: Carl McVoy (January 3, 1931 â€“ January 3, 1992) was an American pianist.
He had been to New York City with his father, who had been a minister there.
McVoy got hooked on boogie-woogie while in New York, which he subsequently brought back to Pine Bluff, Arkansas.
Plucked from the construction industry by Ray Harris, McVoy recorded "You Are My Sunshine" at Sun Records, which was the single that launched Hi Records.
McVoy recorded a number of other sides at Sun in 1957 and 1958, most which have remained unissued.
